text: James Blunt (born James Hillier Blount, 22 February 1974)National Archives, England & Wales, Birth Index: 1916â€“2005 volume 6b, page 446 confirms birth as Q1, 1974 is an English singer-songwriter whose debut album, Back to Bedlam, and single releases, especially "You're Beautiful", brought him to fame in 2005. His repertoire is a mix of pop, rock and acoustic-tinged soft rock. Recording for Linda Perry's independent American label Custard Records, Blunt won two BRIT Awards and two Ivor Novello Awards, and was nominated for five Grammy Awards in 2006. He released his second album All The Lost Souls, in 2007. James Blunt was also in the British Army until 2002. ==Discography== * Back to Bedlam (2004) * All the Lost Souls (2007) * Some Kind of Trouble (2010) * Moon Landing (2013) ==Awards== ===Grammy Awards=== |- | rowspan=5 | 2007 || James Blunt || Best New Artist || |- | rowspan=3 | "You're Beautiful" || Record of the Year|| |- | Song of the Year || |- | Best Male Pop Vocal Performance || |- | Back to Bedlam || Best Pop Vocal Album || ====2005==== * MTV Europe Music Awards - Best New Act * Q Awards - Best New Act * Digital Music Awards - Best Pop Act ====2006==== * NRJ Music Awards (France) - Best International Newcomer * BRIT Awards - Best pop act and Best Male Vocalist * ECHO Awards (Germany) - Best International Newcomer * NME Awards - Worst Album * MTV Australia Video Music Awards - Song of the Year for You're Beautiful * Ivor Novello Awards - Most Performed Work and International Hit of the Year * MTV Video Music Awards - Best Male Video and Best Cinematography * World Music Awards - Best New Artist in the World and Biggest Selling British Artist in the World * Teen Choice Awards (United States) - Choice Music Male Artist ====2008==== * ECHO Awards (Germany) - Best International Male Artist ====2010==== * Virgin Media Music Awards - The Hottest Male ====2011==== * Regenbogen Awards (Germany) - Best International Male Artist ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:British military people Category:English rock musicians Category:English singer-songwriters Category:People from Wiltshire Category:Atlantic Records artists
title: James Blunt
